text:
Situation A. Minimum Conditions for Triangle Congruence

After playing the game, Mr. Tamm’s class came up with several claims about the minimum amount of information needed to show congruence of two triangles. Consider the conditions described for two triangles.

For each claim,

  • Are the conditions enough to determine if the two triangles are congruent? Give an argument to support your answer.
  • If the conditions are not enough to determine two triangles are congruent, give an example to show that it does not work.
